entry.title: At least 2 killed in Yerevan blast

media:group.media:title: At least 2 killed in Yerevan blast
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia‚Äôs defense minister indicated the country has seen significant progress and success in efforts to diversify its defense ties, naming France and India primary partners. üìçAn explosion in Yerevan‚Äôs Erebuni district has left at least two people dead and two injured. The cause of the blast has yet to be determined. üìçThe United States loosened travel restrictions for its diplomats posted to Armenia. üìçThis Week In Business: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DAPSko4wb8A

entry.title: UAE overtakes Russia as Armenia‚Äôs top foreign investor: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: UAE overtakes Russia as Armenia‚Äôs top foreign investor: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia‚Äôs economic activity index grew by 9.4% last year, as trade topped $20 billion for the first time. The United Arab Emirates is now the country‚Äôs top foreign investor. üìçArmenia‚Äôs Central Bank cut interest rates by 50 basis points to 8.75%. üìçFitch affirmed Armenia‚Äôs ‚ÄòBB-‚Äô sovereign credit rating with a ‚Äústable outlook.‚Äù üìçArmenia‚Äôs 1,000 biggest companies paid more than $4.2 billion in taxes last year.

entry.title: What you need to know about the debate over a new constitution for Armenia

media:group.media:title: What you need to know about the debate over a new constitution for Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Controversy is raging over the reasons for Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan‚Äôs plan to replace Armenia‚Äôs Constitution with a new one. Opponents say it is happening under pressure from Azerbaijan, and just yesterday Baku demanded Armenia make the change. This CivilNet special report breaks down what you need to know, and the reasons why the referendum‚Äôs passage is far from assured.

üìçA spokesperson for Russia‚Äôs Foreign Ministry called on Armenia to better understand its ‚Äúnational interests‚Äù after a NATO official said the alliance is open to closer ties with Yerevan. üìçA former senior official at Armenia‚Äôs Economy Ministry was detained along with six other people, reportedly including other ministry officials, as part of two ongoing corruption probes. üìçPolitical donations to Armenia‚Äôs ruling party have fallen under scrutiny after an investigation by the local news outlet Infocom alleging unknown origins to many of the contributions.
